bill_title: require secondary schools to offer parenting classes for academic credit.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require secondary schools to offer parenting classes for academic credit. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-33 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Each public or nonpublic secondary school shall offer its students a course in parenting skills. The course may be for full or partial academic credit and may be a separate course or a component of a family and consumer sciences course, a health course, or other appropriate course. The course shall be at least one-half semester in duration. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require secondary schools to offer parenting classes for academic credit. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-33 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Each public or nonpublic secondary school shall offer its students a course in parenting skills. The course may be for full or partial academic credit and may be a separate course or a component of a family and consumer sciences course, a health course, or other appropriate course. BILL HISTORY 1/21/00 First read in House and referred to Education. H.J. 180 2/3/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/3/00 Education Deferred to another day. 2/8/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/8/00 Education Do Pass Amended, Failed, AYES 6, NAYS 6. 2/8/00 Report out of committee without recommendation as amended, AYES 10, NAYS 2. H.J. 482

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require secondary schools to offer parenting classes for academic credit. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-33 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Each public or nonpublic secondary school shall offer its students a course in parenting skills. The course may be for full or partial academic credit and may be a separate course or a component of a family and consumer sciences course, a health course, or other appropriate course. The course may be taught by a teacher employed by the school or school district or by the county's agent or representative of the Cooperative Extension Service of South Dakota State University. BILL HISTORY 1/21/00 First read in House and referred to Education. H.J. 180 2/3/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/3/00 Education Deferred to another day. 2/8/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/8/00 Education Do Pass Amended, Failed, AYES 6, NAYS 6. 2/8/00 Report out of committee without recommendation as amended, AYES 10, NAYS 2.
